surnames.meaning: Sand (symbolizing resilience and adaptability)
facts: Traced back to the ancient state of Sha during the Zhou Dynasty
Many Sha families settled in Gansu, with some migrating to Central Asia during the Yuan Dynasty

surnames.meaning: Prostrate (symbolizing humility and submission)
facts: Descendants of the noble families from the Zhou Dynasty
Many Fu families migrated to Korea during the Tang Dynasty

facts: Originated from the ancient state of Cen during the Zhou Dynasty
Concentrated in Guangxi province, with some families moving to Vietnam during the Tang Dynasty

Many Xu families settled in Jiangsu, with some migrating to the Philippines during the Ming Dynasty

facts: Descendants of the noble families from the Zhou Dynasty
Many Bao families migrated to Southeast Asia during the 19th century

surnames.meaning: Practice, habit; symbolizes learning and continuous improvement
facts: The surname Xi originated from the ancient place name 'Shaoxi' in the Qin State during the Spring and Autumn period, now located about 180 miles east of Shang County, Shaanxi. It was later known as Wuguan, and people residing there adopted Xi as their surname.
Many individuals from the Xī ethnic minority group, after integrating into Han culture, changed their surnames to Xi or Xi.
The Xi surname is widely distributed across China, with approximately 87% of the population concentrated in Hunan and Shaanxi provinces.
